subject: Re: [junit] new to esclipse and can't get junit configured
msgSnippet: ... Hi, Nuttzy. First of all, I don t think just placing junit-4.8.1.jar under eclipse plugins will work. Though I m not entirely familiar with how Eclipse
messageBody:
On Sun, Mar 28, 2010 at 6:09 AM, nuttzy99 <nuttzy@...> wrote:
> My version of Eclipse is 1.2.2 for PHP Devs (my primary lang) containing Eclipse 3.5.2.
>
> Sounds like I've not installed something.  I do have this:
> C:\Program Files\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.8.2.v20090203-1005
>
> And I also downloaded and placed junit-4.8.1.jar in that same dir.

Hi, Nuttzy. First of all, I don't think just placing junit-4.8.1.jar
under eclipse\plugins will work. Though I'm not entirely familiar with
how Eclipse plugin loading works, I would advise against it because
Eclipse might get confused and you'll start running into classpath
issues.

I think you need to go to "Help" -> "Install New Software..." then
pick the Galileo software site (I'm just guessing where the plugin is
located, YMMV) and look for something like "JUnit Testing Framework
Version 4".

Hope I managed to point you in the general direction.

- alistair
